author: rich
title: FREE MONEY Direct Marketing
description:
Entrepreneurs need **seed funding** to develop ideas into minimum viable products with marketable potential.

|

https://youtu.be/eR7Bx7hDX04

assessments.note: It is not easy to address people that are suited to make proposals  on catalyst but establishing contact with Entrepreneurial Community Builders and organize events that target entrepreneurs is a convincing approach to successfully implement it.
Seems like a good way to entrepreneurs to propose ideas to Catalyst.

Project catalyst tasks of this Fund's head are ideally summarised by "We will get the most trusted source an entrepreneur has to tell them about Catalyst's FREE MONEY to build their startup". The approach to have events to make potential startups take part in catalyst sounds logical and addresses Catalyst's challenge in attracting passionate startups.

The suggested proposal would create a secondary option to receive initial funding for developers in a shorter period of time. At the moment, presenting on Catalyst is challenging for proposers since they are competing with more seasoned teams, and challenging for CAs since they have to review ideas and not products. This proposal would address both issues and help streamline the process of launching a project on Cardano.

I apologize if I did not understand perfectly, however the difference between what you've already been doing and this proposal is that now all the attention goes to Project Catalyst (the fund5 will be the only sponsor of the event and it'll be mandatory to submit a proposal)? 
If this is the case, is there a chance to diminish the movement of the events due the absence of great sponsor's names?
Besides that, I really see value in this proposal.
assessments.reply: The main sponsor would be Catalyst, not the only Sponsor.  And it is a separate set of events, not related to current events.

assessments.note: The described success story of the concept is very convincing. Having participated in similar events myself, I can confirm the desired effect on the participants.
The proposer has established credentials in organizing startup events. It is likely to attract startups with restrictions in funds to take part in Catalyst.

The proposer appears to be a highly experienced entrepreneur with knowledge in organizing and leading Hackathons. They claim to have collaborated with Fund2 winners prior to them joining project Catalyst and have a team of individuals capable of handling the task.
The use of the requested capital is well explained. The number of events held is an obvious KPI. The estimated costs seem reasonable.
It would be good to know how many people are directly reached through each of the 4 36hr Hackathons.

The proposal explains the process very clearly and has listed steps that will be undertaken in chronological order. The proposal has verifiable settings and can present measurable outcomes in terms of a number of proposers attracted and funded in Catalyst through these events.

The proposer provided a detailed breakdown of their project with sufficient information on budgetary needs and expenditures, roadmap timelines, and team description. They have also set forth a number of goals and milestones which will be easy to track in order to gauge the success of their endeavor.

It was a great idea to implement as metric the need to mention the program in submitting an idea.
However, it could include as well a manner to measure the 'non-proposers' contribution as well, like CA/Voters, since I imagine that the events will give visibility not only to the entrepreneurs itself, but to viewers and contributors.
assessments.reply: Yes, we will keep track of audience as well.

solution: Work with WW Entrepreneurial Community Builders to drive awareness of **alternative funding** thru Catalyst for blockchain projects.
experience: Entrepreneur of 18 startups; mentor startups 7 yrs; WW Community Leader for Techstars Startup Weekend; Producer of WyoHackathon, marketing.
